Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported in Switzerland 
    Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea released a statement on Oct. 19 on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
 The statement said that President Kim Il Sung set forth the above-said proposal at the 6th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea in October 1980. It referred to the 10-point policy to be pursued by the federal state. It continued:    
 The proposal serves as a fair and aboveboard, democratic and realistic one for reunification as it does not allow one side to absorb the other side but enables both sides to keep their socio- economic systems as they are on the principle of "one nation and one state, two systems and two governments."
 Holding that the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces should be withdrawn from south Korea if the proposal is to be realized, the statement demanded the U.S. stop all sorts of interference in the internal affairs of Korea and put an immediate end to its criminal moves to provoke a new war.

Vietnamese Diplomats Help Korean Farmers 
    Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Phan Trong Thai and embassy officials Friday gave helping hands to the farmers of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Jamjin Cooperative Farm in Kangso County, South Phyongan Province, in harvesting.
 They helped the farmers in carrying rice sheaves. During break they sang songs and talked with farmers, deepening the friendly feelings.
 The ambassador said that he was deeply impressed to see farmers working so hard, expressing the belief that the farmers there will make greater success in their agricultural production.    
 They conveyed aid materials to the farm that day.

Pak Pong Ju Congratulates PM of New Zealand
    Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Helen Clark upon her reelection as prime minister of New Zealand. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message wished her success in her work.
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his New Zealand counterpart Winston Peters upon his appointment as foreign minister of the country.

Congratulations to Polish President
    Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Lech Aleksander Kaczynski upon his election as Polish president.
 Expressing the belief that the relations between the two countries would favorably develop in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the Polish president great success in his responsible work.
